Senior Executive, Warehouse Job at Smartflow Technologies Limited




        
    

        
        Smartflow Technologies Limited is Nigeria’s foremost Flow and Level Automation company, delivering premium and yet cost-effective solutions to clients with unparalleled professionalism and skill. In addition to being an engineering-focused organization, Smartflow Technologies is involved in the supply, installation, and support of fuelling systems and equipment, including but not limited to Pumps and Dispensers. Since its inception in 2009, Smartflow Technologies has deployed solutions and systems for nearly 30 clients in various industries, ranging from Agriculture, Banking, Cement, Food & Beverages, Logistics, Oil & Gas, and Transportation, among other thriving sectors of the economy

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Senior Executive, Warehouse

Job Location: Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Keeping records of items shipped, received from the project site, or transferred to other warehouse locations.
	Ensure effective stock management through proper documentation.
	Implement intelligent monitoring to minimize stock discrepancies.
	Prepare management and inventory reports on warehouse activities.
	Conduct branch stock analysis to support data-driven decision-making and interbase transfer.
	Perform stock audit exercises to verify physical inventory against system records and resolve variances promptly.
	To find, sort, or move goods within different parts of the warehouse.
	To compile reports on various aspects of changes in production or inventory.
	To ensure the store is well organized and to maintain the neatness and tidiness of the warehouse.
	To check the materials thoroughly for quality, quantity & any specific condition.
	To develop and implement a (proactive) tools maintenance program.
	To ensure that maintenance reports are drafted properly.
	To ensure goods which goes out and come in from time to time are tracked properly.
	To ensure proper authorization for all goods entering and leaving the warehouse
	To input supplies into the warehouse inventory system and to check for accuracy.
	To ensure that all tool maintenance operations are done in accordance with company policy and OSHA guidelines.
	Coordinate with the OHS coordinator and investigate all reported incidents (near-misses and accidents)


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Accounting/Data Analytics with 2 - 3 years of post-NYSC experience
	Must have excellent communication skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
	Knowledge of occupational health and safety will be an added advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@smartflowtech.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at GE (NYSE:GE)
content:
GE (NYSE:GE) drives the world forward by tackling its biggest challenges. By combining world-class engineering with software and analytics, GE helps the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely. GE people are global, diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest integrity and passion to fulfill GE’s mission and deliver for our customers.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Compliance Monitoring Specialist

Job ID: R4035731
Job Location: Onne, Rivers
Sector:  GE Healthcare

Job Description Summary
     

            
    




	The Compliance Monitoring Specialist is responsible for designing, executing, and enhancing risk?based compliance monitoring and testing activities across the International Region.
	The role ensures that controls operate effectively, regulatory obligations are met, and issues are remediated in a timely manner.
	The specialist partners with Business, Legal, Internal Audit, Finance, and HR to strengthen the control environment, reduce misconduct risks, and drive a culture of integrity.


Job Description
Key responsibilities/essential functions include:


	Develop and execute risk?based monitoring plans covering mainly Compliance risks and policies (Indirect Third Parties, HCP engagements and travel & expenses, etc.).
	Perform control testing using documented test scripts, sampling methodologies, and statistically sound approaches.
	Conduct transaction reviews identifying anomalies, potential slush fund indicators, or policy breaches.
	Utilize data analytics to identify patterns and outliers.
	Has the ability to prioritize information for data analysis. Uses technical experience and analytical thinking.
	Document findings with clear root cause analysis, risk ratings, and remediation plans.
	Prepare dashboards and periodic reports for senior management and governance forums.
	Provide feedback to improve policies, SOPs, and control design based on monitoring results.
	Uses some judgment and has the ability to propose different solutions outside of set parameters to address more complicated, day-to-day problems
	Partner with Legal, Finance, Internal Audit, Procurement, Dealer Compliance, Channel Excellence and other relevant parties to strengthen controls.
	Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.
	May lead small projects with low risks and resource requirements.
	Explains information; developing skills to bring team members to consensus around topics within field.
	Conveys performance expectations and may handle sensitive issues.


Requirements
Required Qualifications:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Law, Economics, Audit, or related field.
	Experience in compliance, internal audit, risk management, or forensic accounting.
	Experience with monitoring/testing methodologies, control frameworks, and documentation standards.
	Working knowledge of Independent Third Part risk, AML, FCPA/UK Bribery Act, industry codes (EFPIA/MedTech).
	Strong analytical skills; proficiency with Excel/Power BI/Tableau and data analysis techniques.
	Excellent communication skills in English; ability to write concise, evidence?based reports.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Background in healthcare/pharma/med?tech or other regulated industries.
	Certifications: CCEP, CIA, CFE or equivalent.
	Experience with SAP/Oracle, case management systems.
	Familiarity with statistical sampling


Application Closing Date: 7th March, 2026.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Associate Contract Performance Manager

Job ID: R5029624
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description Summary


	This job entails working with a CPM with an assigned customer portfolio for the planning, execution and closeout of parts and services projects with the sole aim of achieving profitability for GE and customer satisfaction.
	It requires collaboration with internal and external stakeholders to achieve the above aim.
	The candidate will also support the commercial drive to expand the opportunities within the assigned customer portfolio.
	You will report to the service director and fulfil other functions within the sub-region related to the p&l portfolio.


Job Description
What you'll do:


	Perform in the role as the interface between the customer and GE.
	Own and coordinate the profitability of the assigned customer portfolio
	Coordinate the shipment of gas turbine and other parts as per customer contract terms.
	Plan and execute gas turbine maintenance and troubleshooting services per GE standard requirements and the terms of the customer contract/ purchase order.
	Coordinate project closeout per GE standard requirements
	Oversee the issuance of customer invoices and the collection of cash per the terms of the contract and invoices.
	Support the sales and commercial team in generating more commercial opportunities for the company.
	Support manager and senior contracts personnel on assigned contracts.
	Function as the liaison for the customer on contract matters
	Uses some judgment and has some ability to propose different solutions outside of set parameters to address and resolve customer operational and commercial issues.
	Uses technical experience and analytical thinking.
	Uses multiple internal and limited external sources outside of own teams to arrive at decisions.
	Collaborate with the manager to deliver immediate and overall business objectives.
	Basic understanding of key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work. Good understanding of how the work of one's own team integrates with other teams and contributes to the area.
	May have some autonomy to make decisions within a defined framework. Resolves issues in situations that require good technical knowledge and judgment within established procedures. Consults more senior team members for issues outside of defined instructions/parameters.
	A job at this level requires good interpersonal skills and may be required to lead a junior team. For customer-facing roles, develops strong customer relationships and serves as the interface between the customer and GE. Explains technical information to others.


Requirements
What you'll bring:


	Bachelor's Degree in Engineering from an accredited university.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in GEV gas turbines operations and maintenance with relevant customer relationship and commercial know-how.
	Fluency in verbal and written English.


What'll make you stand out:


	Strong oral and written communication skills.
	Willing to take initiative with a proactive mindset and approach.
	Ability to work with minimum supervision.
	Ability to work in a matrix environment.
	Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office packages, particularly with Excel, PowerPoint and Word.


Application Closing Date: 13th February, 2026.

Click here to apply online

Executive Warehouse Officer Job at Smartflow Technologies Limited




        
    

        
        Smartflow Technologies Limited is Nigeria’s foremost Flow and Level Automation company, delivering premium and yet cost-effective solutions to clients with unparalleled professionalism and skill. In addition to being an engineering-focused organization, Smartflow Technologies is involved in the supply, installation, and support of fuelling systems and equipment, including but not limited to Pumps and Dispensers. Since its inception in 2009, Smartflow Technologies has deployed solutions and systems for nearly 30 clients in various industries, ranging from Agriculture, Banking, Cement, Food & Beverages, Logistics, Oil & Gas, and Transportation, among other thriving sectors of the economy.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Warehouse Officer

Job Location: Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Keeping records of items shipped, received from the project site, or transferred to other warehouse locations.
	Ensure effective stock management through proper documentation.
	Implement intelligent monitoring to minimize stock discrepancies.
	Prepare management reports on warehouse activities.
	Conduct branch stock analysis to support data-driven decision-making.
	To find, sort, or move goods within different parts of the warehouse.
	To compile reports on various aspects of changes in production or inventory.
	To ensure the store is well organized and to maintain the neatness and tidiness of the warehouse.
	To check the materials thoroughly for quality, quantity & any specific condition.
	To develop and implement a (proactive) tools maintenance program.
	To ensure that maintenance reports are drafted properly.
	To ensure goods which goes out and come in from time to time are tracked properly.
	To ensure proper authorization for all goods entering and leaving the warehouse
	To input supplies into the warehouse inventory system and to check for accuracy.
	To ensure that all tool maintenance operations are done in accordance with company policy and OSHA guidelines.
	Coordinate with the OHS coordinator and investigate all reported incidents (near-misses and accidents).


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Accounting/Statistics/Data Analytics
	0 - 1 year of post NYSC experience
	Must have excellent communication skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
	Knowledge of occupational health and safety will be an added advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@smartflowtech.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
